meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The impostor claimed to be a doctor, but he had no medical training.
meanings.sent2: The impostor was caught trying to enter the building using a fake ID.
meanings.sent3: The impostor at the party pretended to be a famous celebrity and fooled everyone.
meanings.sent4: The impostor's mask of kindness hid his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the impostor who tries to steal your identity online.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives others by pretending to be someone they are not.
meanings.sent1: The impostor in the play wore a disguise to trick the other characters.
meanings.sent2: She realized her friend was an impostor when he couldn't remember any shared memories.
meanings.sent3: The impostor's attempt to mimic the teacher's voice was both funny and unsuccessful.
meanings.sent4: The impostor's charm was just a facade to hide his true nature.
meanings.sent5: The impostor's lies unraveled when his fake accent slipped.
